intro: Chaenanthe ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian chaenanthe, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that typically display vibrant colors such as red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
